questions.question: Which of the following sentences is in the present perfect?
options: She has watched the movie already.
questions.explanation: The present perfect is formed using 'has/have' + past participle, such as 'has watched'.

questions.question: Choose the correct present perfect form: She __________ (to finish) her homework.
questions.explanation: The sentence requires 'has finished' because the subject 'She' uses 'has' in present perfect.

questions.question: Which verb is correct in this sentence: They __________ (to go) to Canada twice.
questions.explanation: With 'They' as the subject, 'have gone' is the correct present perfect form.

questions.question: Select the sentence in the present perfect form:
options: He has built a new house.
She was building a new house.
I will build a new house.
questions.explanation: 'He has built a new house' is present perfect, using 'has' + past participle 'built'.

questions.question: What is the past participle of 'see'?
questions.explanation: The past participle of 'see' is 'seen'.

questions.question: Which sentence is in present perfect?
questions.explanation: 'Have you ever visited France?' is in the present perfect form using 'have' + past participle 'visited'.

questions.question: Identify the correct sentence: I __________ (to be) to Japan.
questions.explanation: 'Have been' is the correct present perfect form with 'I'.

questions.question: Select the incorrect sentence in present perfect:
questions.explanation: 'She' requires 'has' in present perfect, so 'She have eaten dinner' is incorrect.

questions.question: What is the past participle of 'write'?
questions.explanation: The past participle of 'write' is 'written'.

questions.question: Choose the best option: How long __________ (you/live) here?
questions.explanation: 'How long have you lived here?' uses present perfect to indicate ongoing action from the past to the present.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: We __________ (never/see) such a beautiful place.
questions.explanation: 'Have never seen' is the present perfect form showing experience.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence in present perfect:
options: She has just finished her report.
questions.explanation: Present perfect 'She has just finished' indicates completion of an action very recently.

questions.question: Which verb is in the present perfect tense?
questions.explanation: 'Have played' is in the present perfect tense using 'have' + past participle.

questions.question: What is the past participle of 'go'?
questions.explanation: The past participle of 'go' is 'gone'.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the present perfect tense?
questions.explanation: 'They have arrived' is in the present perfect using 'have' + past participle 'arrived'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: We __________ (already/clean) the house.
questions.explanation: 'Have already cleaned' is the present perfect form indicating the action is completed before now.

questions.question: Choose the correct word order: __________ (you/ever/be) to Australia?
questions.explanation: 'Have you ever been' is the correct word order for forming questions in present perfect.

questions.question: Which form is correct: He __________ (to lose) his keys.
questions.explanation: 'Has lost' is correct because 'He' uses 'has' in present perfect.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: She __________ (to read) this book five times.
questions.explanation: 'Has read' indicates repeated action up to now in the present perfect.

questions.question: Which of these sentences is NOT in the present perfect?
options: I have never been to Italy.
He travels to Paris every summer.
questions.explanation: 'He travels to Paris every summer' is in the simple present, not present perfect.
